trial_identification.studytitle: An open trial of a self-guided internet-delivered treatment program for obsessive-compulsive disorder
trial_identification.scientifictitle: An open trial of a self-guided internet-delivered CBT treatment program for adults with obsessive-compulsive disorder

interventions.interventions: Participants will complete 6 online lessons in 8 weeks. The online lessons take approximately 30 minutes to read through, with homework exercises taking a further hour per day. The lessons are based on current best practice cognitive and behavioural techniques and include exposure and response prevention, and cognitive techniques. Exposure and response prevention involves gradually confronting feared situations whilst resisting the compulsive behaviours that would normally be used to reduce anxiety. The cognitive techniques are aimed at reducing the common cognitive biases seen in OCD and are aimed to help the participant to reduce their overestimation of threat and responsibility, reduce the need to control their thoughts and understand the misinterpretation of the meaning of these thoughts. The cognitive techniques also aim to help people to reduce their need for certainty and perfectionism.
interventions.comparator: This is an open trial. There is no control group.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline Weekly Post-education (8 weeks) 3 month follow up
Baseline Mid-treatment (4 weeks) Post-education (8 weeks) 3 month follow up

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline Weekly Post-education (8 weeks) 3 month follow up

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Acceptability Questionnaire - This questionnaire has been developed specifically for this study

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: An Australian resident Aged 18-65 years Have access to a computer with internet access Elevated symptoms of obsessive-compulsive disorder (score equal to or greater than 16 on the total YBOCS or 10 or more on either the obsessions or compulsions subscale).
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: History of or current Psychosis/mania Current Suicidal plans or severe depression Score less than 16 on the YBOCS

trial_design.concealment: Participants will be recruited via the eCentreClinic website (www.ecentreclinic.org) and undergo screening online. If participants meet all inclusion/exclusion criteria they are allocated to the treatment group and notified via email.
trial_design.sequence: This is a non randomised trial

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: eCentreClinic Centre for Emotional Health Department of Psychology Macquarie University NSW 2109

fundingsource.fundingaddress: eCentreClinic Centre for Emotional Health Department of Psychology Macquarie University NSW 2109

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The aim of this study is to evaluate the use of a self-guided internet treatment program for OCD. It is hypothesized that: 1. The treatment group will show significant improvement on primary measures of OCD symptoms relative to baseline and 2. The treatment will be deemed as acceptable by participants

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Macquarie University Human Research Ethics Committee
